action.action-desc: Mr. Takano introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Education and the Workforce

form.official-title: To allow funds under title II of the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 to be used to provide training to school personnel regarding how to recognize child sexual abuse.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Helping Schools Protect Our Children Act of 2014.
Section 2103(a) of the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 (20 U.S.C. 6603(a)) is amended by striking 2002 and inserting 2015.

section.header: Training teachers to recognize child sexual abuse

subsection.text: Section 2113(c) of the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 (20 U.S.C. 6613(c)) is amended by adding at the end the following:

paragraph.text: Providing training for all school personnel, including teachers, principals, and pupil services personnel, regarding how to recognize child sexual abuse.

subsection.text: Section 2123(a) of the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 (20 U.S.C. 6623(a)) is amended by inserting after paragraph (8) the following:

paragraph.text: Providing training for all school personnel, including teachers, principals, and pupil services personnel, regarding how to recognize child sexual abuse.
